Package edu.monash.fit2099.simulator.matter

Interface ActionInterface

  • All Superinterfaces:

    All Known Subinterfaces:
    HPActionInterface
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Action, Affordance, Attack, Cast, Drink, Give, HPAction, HPAffordance, Leave, Move, Take
    public interface ActionInterface
extends java.lang.Comparable<ActionInterface>
    Interface for Actions

    • Method Detail

      • getDuration

        int getDuration()
        Returns the length of time the Action will take. This can be longer or shorter than the duration of a tick, but even if it is shorter than half a tick, the Actor performing it doesn't get an extra move. If you want Actors to be able to act more than once in a turn, have your turns comprise more than one tick.

        The Scheduler uses this method to determine the order in which Actions will be completed. Actions of short duration complete before Actions of long duration.

        Returns:
        the length of time an Action takes
        See Also:
        Scheduler

      • execute

        void execute​(Actor<?> actor)
        Carries out the actual Action.
        Parameters:
        actor - the Actor performing the Action

      • getDescription

        java.lang.String getDescription()
        Returns a description of the Action suitable for display. This may need to be computed, e.g. to include the name of the Actor or the target.
        Returns:
        description of the Action

      • getPriority

        int getPriority()
        Returns the priority of the Action. Priority is represented by an integer where a smaller integer corresponds to lower priority than a larger one. The lowest possible priority is zero (0).

        Actions with higher priority are executed before all Actions with lower priority scheduled within the same tick. Actions with the same priority scheduled within the same tick, will be executed in an arbitrary order.

        The Scheduler use the priority of Action to order Events within a tick.

        Returns:
        the priority of the Action

      • compareTo

        default int compareTo​(ActionInterface other)
        compareTo method to order ActionInterface objects in alphabetical order based on their descriptions
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<ActionInterface>
